Description: Lip and body sherd of East Greek pottery cup; concave wall, lip projecting outwards; interior glazed; top of lip reserved; exterior: lip glazed; narrow painted band on reserved area below; inscription incised on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Both names and words commencing asku[ are extremely rare, and it seems unlikely that there is more than one word here. One might consider whether the initial letter was intended to be eta - e.g. 'the Scythian female is ....'
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 700, no. 576, pl. 25.16)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.345)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
